sentence.Network_en: His people had fallen further and further into a quagmire of confusion.

sentence.Network_en: We have no intention of being drawn into a political quagmire.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们无意卷入一场政治困境。

sentence.Network_en: My wellingtons got stuck in a quagmire.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的威灵顿长靴陷在泥坑里.

list.abs: I served in that quagmire and by god this Dipshit plan sucks , plain and simple Keep these COMMIE bastards out of our business , Clinton already gave them the ranch .我曾在那泥沼内服役，那笨蛋计划拖住我们，明白简单的让它脱离我们的掌握，克林顿已经给了他们大农场。

and as for the Republicans : now that their policies of tax cuts and deregulation have led us into an economic quagmire , their prescription for recovery is-tax cuts and deregulation .至于共和党人，既然他们的减税和放松管制的政策让我们陷入了一个经济泥潭，他们为复苏而开的药方就是——减税和放松管制。
）早在1967年出版的一本书中写道，在商业大潮冲击下，越战是美国的陷阱（a quagmire），亦逐渐本土化、中华化了。Legal quagm…
your simple behaviour may result a quagmire of errors , mis-directed activity and utter frustration .你一个简单的行为会导致你的工作陷入泥沼，工作方向被误导以及绝对的挫折感。
Today , you are prisoners of your own quagmire ., 今天 , 你们陷在你们自己的困境中.

entry.tran: (难以避免或摆脱的)复杂局势，困境
entry.def: A quagmire is a difficult, complicated, or unpleasant situation which is not easy to avoid or escape from.

example.ex: His people had fallen further and further into a quagmire of confusion...
example.tran: 他的人民在混乱不安的泥潭里越陷越深。

example.ex: We have no intention of being drawn into a political quagmire.
example.tran: 我们无意卷入一场政治困境。

entry.def: A quagmire is a soft, wet area of land which your feet sink into if you try to walk across it.

example.ex: Rain had turned the grass into a quagmire.
example.tran: 大雨使草地变得一片泥泞。

means.word_mean: 1. a soft wet area of low-lying land that sinks underfoot

sentences.en: He who tries to conceal his fault for fear of criticism will sink deeper and deeper in the quagmire of errors.
sentences.cn: 讳疾忌医的人,错误越陷越深。
